entry.title: Amṛtasiddhi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Amṛtasiddhi (folio pictured), translated as 'the attainment of immortality', is an early text about what later became haṭha yoga?

entry.title: Joe Kraker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Joe Kraker was said to be the only lineman in football history to play without shoulder pads?

entry.title: Violin Concerto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Violin Concerto by Mieczysław Weinberg, premiered in Moscow in 1961 by Leonid Kogan, was first performed in Germany by Linus Roth in 2014, and in the U.S. by Gidon Kremer in 2015?

entry.title: Jindřiška Flajšhansová (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that from 1912, Jindřiška Flajšhansová was the principal editor of Ženské listy, a Czech journal that became a women's "survival manual" during World War I?

entry.title: Ponce de Leon Springs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ponce de Leon Springs in Atlanta was named in reference to the legend of Juan Ponce de León's search for the Fountain of Youth due to the spring water's supposed health benefits?

entry.title: Elizabeth II's 1994 state visit to Russia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Elizabeth II's 1994 state visit to Russia was overshadowed in the UK by a Prince Charles biographical book?

entry.title: Maria Bakalova (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Maria Bakalova thought that her Borat Subsequent Moviefilm audition might have been part of a human trafficking scheme?

entry.title: CNN Tonight (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Don Lemon "didn't mean to set the internet on fire" when teasing the rebranding of CNN Tonight to Don Lemon Tonight?
